CatDescriptText: Mr. English Burton, janitor, 1314 Goble St. and Mrs. Ernestine Epps, cashier, Schenley Heights, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 6, 1962, pg.7 with question: "What goal or goals should the Pittsburgh Negro aim for in 1962?"  Mr. English Burton's answer reads: "I think that one of the goals should be to make every opportunity available and pave the way so our children can do better than we.  And also, we should try to cooperate more together."  Mrs. Ernestine Epps' answer reads: "We should establish our own businesses so our young children will have better opportunities."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of English Burton wearing light colored leather jacket and scarf, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Ernestine Epps wearing dark tweed coat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
